website_summaries.verdict: A powerful knife made of quality steel for a great price.
pros: German stainless steel with a very sharp blade and a lot of weight to it
Offers corrosion resistance for long-lasting performance
High polymer handle is ergonomic and comfortable
cons: Almost too heavy to use as a vegetable cleaver
Better used as a meat cleaver

customer_reviews.title: Great Chefs Knife
customer_reviews.text: The blade seems to hold an edge quite well, which it should with a Rockwell hardness of 58+. The details tell us that the steel is German. However, this knife is made in China. It is a good value, although I would have preferred American Made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best price & it holds up to my findings...
customer_reviews.text: Knowing NOTHING about meat cleavers, I did some research & came across this brand in an article of the best meat cleavers. It was for a gift. Needless to say, he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Logan414

customer_reviews.title: Good knife but smaller than I thought.
customer_reviews.text: Good knife. Sharp enough. I thought it’s too small for a cleaver. The old one we have is bigger and does the heavy duty cutting. This one doesn’t seem to be big enough to do the job my regular knife can’t do.
customer_reviews.author: Omkara

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and surprisingly durable
customer_reviews.text: Out of the package, sharp enough to make translucent slices of ginger. Was also able to slice through newspaper easily. After two months of daily use, still holds up about as well with no noticeable difference in ease of chopping. The shape makes the knife useful as a bench scraper, though probably not in the long-run if you want to keep the edge.
customer_reviews.author: wwxx

customer_reviews.title: Craftsmanship is on par with much more expensive cleavers.
customer_reviews.text: Wicked sharp out of the box! Weight is somewhere in the middle compared to other cleavers I was considering. Not to light or heavy - just right. Very comfortable and balanced. Cuts through chicken bones easily.
customer_reviews.author: J.P.A.

customer_reviews.title: Wow, REALLY sharp!
customer_reviews.text: This cleaver is well balanced, and extremely sharp! My wife managed to cut her finger when she brushed against it, and she’s not even Chinese! Seriously, it’s very well made. Hefty. Solid. I highly recommend this knife.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this knife for my daughter. I have a similar knife that she liked, so when I saw this I ordered one for her.
customer_reviews.author: K-Mac

customer_reviews.title: none
customer_reviews.text: I have always been told these are not clevers, but Chinese Slicing Knives. Thet work much better than a butcher knife
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Cleaver for the steady cook.
customer_reviews.text: Great knife. Well balanced, ergonomic, dependable and very esthetic. Not the sharpest for fine slicing but it’s a cleaver. Great through hacking through bones and connective tissue in a jif. I can tell I’ll have this cleaver for years to come. A must have for any aspiring cook that’s not looking to break the bank on a cleaver.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur R. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully finished, razor sharp
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality for the price. Looks like it belongs with our Zwilling J.A. Henckels set.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey Padden
